intro: Senecio organensis, commonly known as the Organ Mountains groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the desert regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh desert conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Senecio organensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for small desert organisms.
